dialog-bert-start.name: %Bert%
messages: Who needs help?

dialog-bert-end.name: %Bert%
messages: Perhaps the world.

dialog-bert-catwork.name: %Bert%
messages: Max. Purple man.
Max wants his house to be built.

dialog-bert-shepherd.name: %Bert%
messages: The shepherd.
He had one job.

dialog-bert-bender.name: %Bert%
messages: Robot?
Some kind of robot.
I do not know this robot.
...I think he took my watch.

dialog-bert-baker.name: %Bert%
messages: Baker.
Baker is busy. He has trouble with customer.

dialog-bert-bobmoss.name: %Bert%
messages: Cousin of Stone Cold Bob Austin.
He is lost. Or is he hiding?

dialog-bert-delmar1.name: %Bert%
messages: Old woman, beatrice.
She has been sad a long time.

dialog-bert-trekkie.name: %Bert%
messages: Trekkie.
Trekkie works on plants in the glass house.

dialog-bert-sportskid.name: %Bert%
messages: Small child with big dream.
Child lives with father.

dialog-bert-delmar2.name: %Bert%
messages: Old woman, Beatrice.
Does she know what she wants?

dialog-bert-goose.name: %Bert%
messages: Goose is mad?
Goose is always mad.
Perhaps... extra mad this time?

dialog-jackob-start.name: %Jackob%
messages: Did you have a question?

dialog-jackob-hint-hackbook1.name: %PLAYER%
messages:
Well... I found this book in the inner
sanctum, and I had a question about it.

dialog-jackob-hint-hackbook1.name: %Jackob%
messages: Of course. What do you want to know?

dialog-jackob-hint-hackbook1.name: %PLAYER%
messages:
You see, it's a book about the Big Bad,
but the words inside are all scrambled up.

dialog-jackob-hint-hackbook1.name: %Jackob%
messages: I see.

Perhaps that's something the Big Bad did.
It would be logical for him to hide
information about himself.

dialog-jackob-hint-hackbook1.name: %PLAYER%
messages:
But what can I do to get the book back to
normal?

dialog-jackob-hint-hackbook1.name: %Jackob%
messages:
The Big Bad had powers beyond what you can
do with that ring alone, %PLAYER%.

I suspect it's something even Ring Zero
cannot fix.

dialog-jackob-hint-hackbook1.name: %PLAYER%
messages:
Do you know what the book used to say,
at least?

dialog-jackob-hint-hackbook1.name: %Jackob%
messages:
That book... I must have read it before,
but....

dialog-jackob-hint-hackbook3.name: %Jackob%
messages: Oh, %PLAYER%, I'm sorry.

I can't remember anything about what the
book said.

I suppose it doesn't matter, either way.
The Big Bad is gone, perhaps for good.

dialog-jackob-hint-hackbook3.name: %PLAYER%
messages:
But the Big Bad's name used to be in that
book!

It made me realize that I've never heard
his name before. Not once!
Do you know what his name is?

dialog-jackob-hint-hackbook3.name: %Jackob%
messages: I must have known it, once.
But....
I can't remember.
I'm sorry, %PLAYER%.

dialog-jackob-hint-hackbook-s.name: %PLAYER%
messages: About that glitched-out book....

dialog-jackob-hint-hackbook-s.name: %Jackob%
messages:
I'm sorry. I don't think there's anything
you can do to fix it.

dialog-jackob-hints.name: %PLAYER%
messages: Not really.

dialog-jackob-hints.name: %Jackob%
messages: Well, then a hint:

dialog-jackob-hint1.name: %Jackob%
messages:
If you've hacked things so badly you're
not sure how you could possibly straighten
things out again....

Walk through a door. The world will right
itself.

dialog-jackob-hint-catwork.name: %PLAYER%
messages: The cat crew needs their cat boss.

dialog-jackob-hint-catwork.name: %Jackob%
messages:
Well, if you can't give them their cat
boss, you might try the next best thing:
A doppelganger!

dialog-jackob-hint-shepherd.name: %PLAYER%
messages:
I guess the shepherd wants me to put the
sheep back inside their pen.

dialog-jackob-hint-shepherd.name: %Jackob%
messages:
That seems simple enough. All you must do
is change their X and Y position until
they are inside the sheep pen.

The hard part will be learning their
names.

dialog-jackob-hint-shepherd.name: %PLAYER%
messages: Names?

dialog-jackob-hint-shepherd.name: %Jackob%
messages:
All sheep have names, but they don't share
them except in the direst of emergencies.

But their names are still inherent in the
data of our world. Their names are not
hidden from you.

You can find their names -- and their
data -- if you look long enough.

I wonder if there was another way of
identifying the entity you were
facing.... I feel like once I might have
known, but....

Ah, well. These days my mind is like...
some kind of... thing you strain rice
with.

dialog-jackob-hint-bender.name: %PLAYER%
messages: Bender wants his ass back, I guess.

dialog-jackob-hint-bender.name: %Jackob%
messages:
Our every state of being can be defined by
data.

In his case, he once existed with a whole
ass, and therefore, there exists an entity
type where his ass is whole.

Though unless you are looking directly at
his ass, it might be difficult to see if
you have succeeded.

dialog-jackob-hint-baker.name: %PLAYER%
messages: How do I get into the Bob's Club?

dialog-jackob-hint-baker.name: %Jackob%
messages:
The bouncer, Stone Cold Bob Austin, is
very strict. If your name is not 'Bob'
exactly, he will not budge.

And just so you know, there are multiple
values which will APPEAR to be a blank
space, but will not satisfy him.

Fortunately, the correct value will
terminate the string his logic is
evaluating, so only the first byte after
'Bob' will matter.

dialog-jackob-hint-bobmoss.name: %PLAYER%
messages:
I heard there might be another Stone Cold
Bob Austin. Like his cousin or something?

dialog-jackob-hint-bobmoss.name: %Jackob%
messages:
Oh, you mean Bob Moss. Yes, he disappears
once in a while.

He's never far. But if you can't find him
in town, you might have to look in places
one cannot normally walk.

dialog-jackob-hint-bea1.name: %PLAYER%
messages:
Beatrice wants her husband to become a man
again.

dialog-jackob-hint-bea1.name: %Jackob%
messages: Ah, yes, a simple entity type change.

You'll know you have the right entity type
when you get to an old man, balding,
hunched over, and in overalls.

dialog-jackob-hint-trekkie.name: %PLAYER%
messages: Trekkie needs help with the Ether Nettle.

dialog-jackob-hint-trekkie.name: %Jackob%
messages: That one might be tricky.

If I understand plant genetics correctly,
then hypothetically.... Ether Nettle
colors are simply variations of a single
entity type.

You won't be able to change the flower
color by changing the entity type, I'm
afraid.

All those flowers should have almost
identical values, I imagine. Try to change
a value they don't have in common.

dialog-jackob-hint-sportskid.name: %PLAYER%
messages: This kid....

He's just running around in circles,
saying he wants to grow up to be some kind
of sports ball.

dialog-jackob-hint-sportskid.name: %Jackob%
messages:
If that's what he wants, that's what he
wants.

dialog-jackob-hint-sportskid.name: %PLAYER%
messages:
Yeah, but... that's not really fixing
something that's broken, though, is it?

He's a living person, but if I change him
into an inanimate object....

Does he cease to be alive? Or a human
being? What if he can't breathe anymore?

What happens to his mind? His memories?
If the ball doesn't have a brain, does it
all go away if I change what he is?
Even if he WANTS to become a ball....

I mean, do I have that right? Does this
stray too much into me playing God?

Don't I have a moral responsibility to
avoid causing harm to those around me?

dialog-jackob-hint-sportskid.name: %Jackob%
messages:
If you turn him into a ball, will that
harm him?

dialog-jackob-hint-sportskid.name: %PLAYER%
messages: I don't know. Will it?

dialog-jackob-hint-sportskid.name: %Jackob%
messages:
Everything you see around you is pixels
and data. All ones and zeroes.

Are any of us really alive? If you change
something, does that change what
fundamentally lies underneath, or only
how it appears?

If life is a game, and you do something
immoral you can immediately revert if you
wish, with no one the wiser, is it truly
an immoral art?

Wouldn't that simply be considered part of
the game you are playing? Why would such
an act ill speak of your character?

dialog-jackob-hint-sportskid.name: %PLAYER%
messages: Wouldn't it?

The way we behave when no one is
looking... doesn't that say more about our
character than anything else?

dialog-jackob-hint-sportskid.name: %Jackob%
messages:
These are questions for philosophers and
gamers. All we mortals can do is fulfill a
child's wish to become sports equipment.

dialog-jackob-hint-bea2.name: %PLAYER%
messages:
Now Beatrice wants her husband to turn
back into a sheep.

dialog-jackob-hint-bea2.name: %Jackob%
messages:
She must have gotten sick of his yammering
again.
Ah, well. You know what to do by now.

dialog-jackob-hint-rake.name: %PLAYER%
messages:
I think the goose wants me to move the
rake.
Perhaps... into the lake?

dialog-jackob-hint-rake.name: %Jackob%
messages:
Likely. You'll need to change the
rake's Y coordinates.

But just so you know, each coordinate
actually spans two bytes, and if the
distance is great enough, you'll have to
change both.

dialog-alfonso-start.name: %Alfonso%
messages:
There's a number of issues around town
that your ring should be able to fix.
There are... now, let's just see....

There are 10 tasks, according to my notes.
Go get 'em!

dialog-alfonso-eval.name: %Alfonso%
messages: You've completed $story-flag-count$ tasks.

dialog-alfonso-eval0.name: %Alfonso%
messages: Nowhere to go now but up!

dialog-alfonso-eval1.name: %Alfonso%
messages: That's the spirit! What a great start!

dialog-alfonso-eval-early.name: %Alfonso%
messages: You're getting the hang of this!

dialog-alfonso-eval-mid.name: %Alfonso%
messages:
Oh, my! You're getting a lot of work done!
Marvelous!

dialog-alfonso-eval-late.name: %Alfonso%
messages: Wow! You're nearly done!

dialog-alfonso-eval-done.name: %Alfonso%
messages:
Incredible! You've done everything on my
list!

dialog-alfonso-wonthedemo.name: %Alfonso%
messages: Congratulations! You fixed the town!

dialog-alfonso-debug-catwork.name: %Alfonso%
messages:
Debug: catwork counted.
Total: $story-flag-count$

dialog-alfonso-debug-shepherd2.name: %Alfonso%
messages:
Debug: shepherd2 counted.
Total: $story-flag-count$

dialog-alfonso-debug-bender2.name: %Alfonso%
messages:
Debug: bender2 counted.
Total: $story-flag-count$

dialog-alfonso-debug-baker2.name: %Alfonso%
messages:
Debug: baker2 counted.
Total: $story-flag-count$

dialog-alfonso-debug-bobmoss.name: %Alfonso%
messages:
Debug: bobmoss counted.
Total: $story-flag-count$

dialog-alfonso-debug-bea-happy.name: %Alfonso%
messages:
Debug: bea-happy counted.
Total: $story-flag-count$

dialog-alfonso-debug-trekkie2.name: %Alfonso%
messages:
Debug: trekkie2 counted.
Total: $story-flag-count$

dialog-alfonso-debug-sportskid.name: %Alfonso%
messages:
Debug: sportskid counted.
Total: $story-flag-count$

dialog-alfonso-debug-bea-relief.name: %Alfonso%
messages:
Debug: bea-relief counted.
Total: $story-flag-count$

dialog-alfonso-debug-rake.name: %Alfonso%
messages:
Debug: rake counted.
Total: $story-flag-count$

dialog-alfonso-story-flag-set.name: %Alfonso%
messages: Story flag count reset (0)

dialog-story-flags-all.name: Debug Sheep
messages: All story flags set to true.

dialog-debug-bob.name: Debug Sheep
messages: Bob shortcut activated.

dialog-debug-bob2.name: Debug Sheep
messages: Extra Bob shortcut activated.

dialog-debug-bob3.name: Debug Sheep
messages: Teleportation in progress.
